title: ... There's NOTHING You & I WON'T DO ...
body_text:
Seven Years Ago ▬
Sputz and McCrorey were South Belmar roommates ..
Diana, Megill, & Spenge hadn't yet completed their undergraduate degrees ..
Avakian happily wore trenchcoats, Chris dressed to impress ..
Stopa enjoyed pajama pants, Travis had half a head of hair  ..
Fitz and Kevin were still teenagers and I wasn't legal to drink ..
but dodgeball players?
▬ Seven Years Later ...
________________________________________
_________
That's how we remember - how we lived - and it's perhaps easier than ever to admit that time surely went fast.
Think, we're talking seven different calendars have been ripped from our walls and thrown away! But those cherished memories of each passing year remain embedded in our minds and hearts; by their simple thought, we were all motivated to continue this magical journey.
This was our collective celebration ..
seven glorious years in the making
.
________________________________________
_________
✷ How It Came To Be: THE ROAD TO SEVEN
In preparation for
East Coast Dodgeball
SEVEN: THE ANNIVERSARY
, I set out on a viral rampage in an effort to attract as many followers as possible. In July, I began extensive work on a
promotional video picture collage
that became available on August 22 to acclaimed reviews from members of the
ECD
community and beyond.
Additionally, some of my written work shifted from the basic statistical background and embellished storyline-driven posts to more opinionated material to provoke further feedback. An example of the such was evident in the entry entitled
Seven WONDERS Of OUR WORLD
which nominated past occurrences and players in a "best of" type format. Hopefully it was worth reading!
Lastly, the coined "BIG ONE" three-vs-three match-up not only had to feature six of the game's most recognized figures, but a
legitimate
reason for the captains' participation
(see below)
. One by one, the pre-determined combatants were revealed throughout the week of August 19 to gain interest in the high-stakes contest.
✷ Questions And Answers: PRE-MATCH TRIVIA CONTEST
I'm always about trying something new and refreshing and felt this was more than suitable. With 84 months worth of facts and stats, why not put them to the test!
Contestants formed at the center line; to the winner, a lifetime supply of bragging rights. In all, it took four measly questions where, in the finale, legendary event general
Rob Avakian outsmarted
ECDElitist
Justin Wolf
for the prized championship.
The introductory question quickly eliminated everyone but Avakian and Wolf from contention - perhaps a good 10 or so participants. From there, the last remaining test takers incorrectly answered the next two questions until Avakian scored with the winning remark to secure the higher grade.
Online Exclusive!
Question #1: How many "Act Of Courage" Award winners are there?
10
, 1, 3, 6
Question #2: What is the Wall v. All series score?
8-6, 7-2,
8-4
, 9-2
Question #3: Of the four, who has won more than one Rimshot Contest?
Spengeman, D. Carty, Stopa,
Decuir
Question #4: Which player never won at a FAMILY AFFAIR event?
Londono
, Teitelbaum, Basista, Vetrano
✷ "THE BIG ONE" For A Reason
It had to feel special before, during, and after SEVEN and man, did it deliver. These six-person attractions never fail to entertain and excite, especially with such athletic balance between the adversarial squads.
For the captains specifically, it may have truly been their final opportunity to grab victory on a premier
ECD
stage. You had the unpredictable
Rob Avakian
, the controversial yet tough-as-nails
Dan Turner
, and the game's finest female all-star
Kelly Oberto
on one side; another array of talents stood in the way comprised of the comedic maniac
Travis Mills
, the charismatic dodging extraordinaire
Joey Smalls
, and the up-and-coming prodigy
Eamon Fitzpatrick
. And to think none of them had ever won "The Big One" - hence the name!
This bout was far from typical or predictable; not once during the night did the lead stretch pass the single point margin. In fact, every round captured was by the trio competing on the East! We've all heard of the "see-saw match-up", but this classic encounter absolutely defined it.
Once 9:15 rolled around, I had no alternative but to guarantee a victor. As a result, rival captains Smalls and Turner were put under extra pressure in the ninth and final round. If either were eliminited in any form or fashion, the game - and the event - was lost.
The Ninth and Final Battle
.. Turner, with painball in hand, remained in a defensive state for much of the game. His counterpart, however, wasn't as lucky; to his credit, Smalls managed to outlast his entire support system. But the opposition was overwhelming and his chance to regenerate fell into enemy hands.
At
East Coast Dodgeball
's unprecedented SEVEN YEAR ANNIVERSARY spectacular,
Rob Avakian, Dan Turner, and Kelly Oberto
defeated
Travis Mills, Joey Smalls, and Eamon Fitzpatrick, 5 - 4
.
I cannot express enough gratitude for everyone who competed at this magical showcase. Trust that it really was once in a lifetime.
✷ Along The SEVEN SIDELINES
Spectators from the nearby tennis area and adjacent basketball court were easily drawn in to this
ECD
presentation. It wasn't hard to notice the liking to several of the sport's mainstays, most notably the fun-loving Joey Smalls.
Furthermore, I find it a real treat when our beloved friends stop by even for a brief visit. The dodgeball-formed couple of Pam D'Luhy and Juan Londono as well as the Winston sisters, their brother Jack, and his girlfriend Jill contributed a couple of laughs before the event even commenced. And how could anyone forget about Mr. Fitzpatrick or Michael Edwards' lovely lady Kristen catching the action from the comfort of their cozy chairs.
✷ SEVEN: By The Numbers And The Some
SEVEN: THE ANNIVERSARY was successfully recorded as the astronomical
one hundred, ninety third (193) spectacular
during the
Tronolone Years
of
ECD
. It was the 172nd placed on a Saturday.
Due to the continued reconstruction of the Wall High School courts, the beloved
Ocean Road Park
battle zone became the choice setting for the second consecutive
ECD
gathering and 24th time overall.
Total attendance equalled
twenty-eight (28)
strong. This terrific turnout was the highest recorded since the 5 YEAR ANNIVERSARY in 2010 and on par with CALL OF DUTY in July 2012.
Twenty-three (23) male competitors
was the largest number since the same five year exravaganza in 2010.
The 3-vs-3 war was only the sixth such match in
ECD
history. Of the six combatants, only Mills and Avakian had previous experience in a similar main event (150 and CXV, respectively). Captains statistics are as follows: Mills 0-3-1, Smalls 1-5-0, Fitzpatrick 1-2-0, Avakian 3-3-0, Turner 2-1-1. and Oberto 1-1-0. It should be noted that several other
ECD
names were approached including Sara DeCuir, Derek Carty, and Michelle Mullins. Kenny Jacobs, who had originally accepted, was unable to attend.
An astounding
19 dodge balls
-
16 bulletballs, 2 painballs, and 1 foam football
- were hurled throughout the duration of SEVEN. Kevin Fitzpatrick set up two large fences on both sides of the battlegrounds .. not a single dodge ball went missing!
The official event anthem was "I Melt With You" by Modern English. This now timeless theme song was featured in the promotional video leading up the annual affair.
How fitting that at SEVEN,
seven new players
competed for the very first time: Ben Barry (#498), Elijah Watkins (#499), Jack Mallett (#500), John Commesso (#501), Leandro Bongiovanni (#502), Nick Perone (#503), and Robert Johnson (#504).
And yes, history was indeed made when the
500th Player
was carved in the annals of
ECD
▬
________________________________________
_________
As I've said before, I've been able to do exactly what I've wanted the last seven years and it's because of your dedication and trust in me and each other that
East Coast Dodgeball
has traveled this far. I hope you enjoyed every ounce of SEVEN: THE ANNIVERSARY.
For anyone interested in viewing two special picture albums, check out the pages below:
✷ Pictures courtesy Dan Spengeman can be seen
HERE
✷ Pictures courtesy Rob Knott and John Tronolone can be seen
HERE
body_html:
Seven Years Ago ▬
Sputz and McCrorey were South Belmar roommates ..
Diana, Megill, & Spenge hadn't yet completed their undergraduate degrees ..
Avakian happily wore trenchcoats, Chris dressed to impress ..
Stopa enjoyed pajama pants, Travis had half a head of hair ..
Fitz and Kevin were still teenagers and I wasn't legal to drink ..

but dodgeball players?
▬ Seven Years Later ...
_________________________________________________

That's how we remember - how we lived - and it's perhaps easier than ever to admit that time surely went fast.

Think, we're talking seven different calendars have been ripped from our walls and thrown away! But those cherished memories of each passing year remain embedded in our minds and hearts; by their simple thought, we were all motivated to continue this magical journey.

This was our collective celebration .. seven glorious years in the making.
_________________________________________________


✷ How It Came To Be: THE ROAD TO SEVEN
In preparation for East Coast Dodgeball SEVEN: THE ANNIVERSARY, I set out on a viral rampage in an effort to attract as many followers as possible. In July, I began extensive work on a promotional video picture collage that became available on August 22 to acclaimed reviews from members of the ECD community and beyond.

Additionally, some of my written work shifted from the basic statistical background and embellished storyline-driven posts to more opinionated material to provoke further feedback. An example of the such was evident in the entry entitled Seven WONDERS Of OUR WORLD which nominated past occurrences and players in a "best of" type format. Hopefully it was worth reading!

Lastly, the coined "BIG ONE" three-vs-three match-up not only had to feature six of the game's most recognized figures, but a legitimate reason for the captains' participation (see below). One by one, the pre-determined combatants were revealed throughout the week of August 19 to gain interest in the high-stakes contest.

✷ Questions And Answers: PRE-MATCH TRIVIA CONTEST
I'm always about trying something new and refreshing and felt this was more than suitable. With 84 months worth of facts and stats, why not put them to the test!

Contestants formed at the center line; to the winner, a lifetime supply of bragging rights. In all, it took four measly questions where, in the finale, legendary event general Rob Avakian outsmarted ECDElitist Justin Wolf for the prized championship.

The introductory question quickly eliminated everyone but Avakian and Wolf from contention - perhaps a good 10 or so participants. From there, the last remaining test takers incorrectly answered the next two questions until Avakian scored with the winning remark to secure the higher grade.

Online Exclusive!
Question #1: How many "Act Of Courage" Award winners are there? 10, 1, 3, 6
Question #2: What is the Wall v. All series score? 8-6, 7-2, 8-4, 9-2
Question #3: Of the four, who has won more than one Rimshot Contest? Spengeman, D. Carty, Stopa, Decuir
Question #4: Which player never won at a FAMILY AFFAIR event? Londono, Teitelbaum, Basista, Vetrano

✷ "THE BIG ONE" For A Reason
It had to feel special before, during, and after SEVEN and man, did it deliver. These six-person attractions never fail to entertain and excite, especially with such athletic balance between the adversarial squads.

For the captains specifically, it may have truly been their final opportunity to grab victory on a premier ECD stage. You had the unpredictable Rob Avakian, the controversial yet tough-as-nails Dan Turner, and the game's finest female all-star Kelly Oberto on one side; another array of talents stood in the way comprised of the comedic maniac Travis Mills, the charismatic dodging extraordinaire Joey Smalls, and the up-and-coming prodigy Eamon Fitzpatrick. And to think none of them had ever won "The Big One" - hence the name!

This bout was far from typical or predictable; not once during the night did the lead stretch pass the single point margin. In fact, every round captured was by the trio competing on the East! We've all heard of the "see-saw match-up", but this classic encounter absolutely defined it.

Once 9:15 rolled around, I had no alternative but to guarantee a victor. As a result, rival captains Smalls and Turner were put under extra pressure in the ninth and final round. If either were eliminited in any form or fashion, the game - and the event - was lost.

The Ninth and Final Battle .. Turner, with painball in hand, remained in a defensive state for much of the game. His counterpart, however, wasn't as lucky; to his credit, Smalls managed to outlast his entire support system. But the opposition was overwhelming and his chance to regenerate fell into enemy hands.

At East Coast Dodgeball's unprecedented SEVEN YEAR ANNIVERSARY spectacular, Rob Avakian, Dan Turner, and Kelly Oberto defeated Travis Mills, Joey Smalls, and Eamon Fitzpatrick, 5 - 4.

I cannot express enough gratitude for everyone who competed at this magical showcase. Trust that it really was once in a lifetime.

✷ Along The SEVEN SIDELINES
Spectators from the nearby tennis area and adjacent basketball court were easily drawn in to this ECD presentation. It wasn't hard to notice the liking to several of the sport's mainstays, most notably the fun-loving Joey Smalls.

Furthermore, I find it a real treat when our beloved friends stop by even for a brief visit. The dodgeball-formed couple of Pam D'Luhy and Juan Londono as well as the Winston sisters, their brother Jack, and his girlfriend Jill contributed a couple of laughs before the event even commenced. And how could anyone forget about Mr. Fitzpatrick or Michael Edwards' lovely lady Kristen catching the action from the comfort of their cozy chairs.

✷ SEVEN: By The Numbers And The Some
SEVEN: THE ANNIVERSARY was successfully recorded as the astronomical one hundred, ninety third (193) spectacular during the Tronolone Years of ECD. It was the 172nd placed on a Saturday.

Due to the continued reconstruction of the Wall High School courts, the beloved Ocean Road Park battle zone became the choice setting for the second consecutive ECD gathering and 24th time overall.

Total attendance equalled twenty-eight (28) strong. This terrific turnout was the highest recorded since the 5 YEAR ANNIVERSARY in 2010 and on par with CALL OF DUTY in July 2012.

Twenty-three (23) male competitors was the largest number since the same five year exravaganza in 2010.

The 3-vs-3 war was only the sixth such match in ECD history. Of the six combatants, only Mills and Avakian had previous experience in a similar main event (150 and CXV, respectively). Captains statistics are as follows: Mills 0-3-1, Smalls 1-5-0, Fitzpatrick 1-2-0, Avakian 3-3-0, Turner 2-1-1. and Oberto 1-1-0. It should be noted that several other ECD names were approached including Sara DeCuir, Derek Carty, and Michelle Mullins. Kenny Jacobs, who had originally accepted, was unable to attend.

An astounding 19 dodge balls - 16 bulletballs, 2 painballs, and 1 foam football - were hurled throughout the duration of SEVEN. Kevin Fitzpatrick set up two large fences on both sides of the battlegrounds .. not a single dodge ball went missing!

The official event anthem was "I Melt With You" by Modern English. This now timeless theme song was featured in the promotional video leading up the annual affair.

How fitting that at SEVEN, seven new players competed for the very first time: Ben Barry (#498), Elijah Watkins (#499), Jack Mallett (#500), John Commesso (#501), Leandro Bongiovanni (#502), Nick Perone (#503), and Robert Johnson (#504).

And yes, history was indeed made when the 500th Player was carved in the annals of ECD ▬



_________________________________________________


As I've said before, I've been able to do exactly what I've wanted the last seven years and it's because of your dedication and trust in me and each other that East Coast Dodgeball has traveled this far. I hope you enjoyed every ounce of SEVEN: THE ANNIVERSARY.

For anyone interested in viewing two special picture albums, check out the pages below:
✷ Pictures courtesy Dan Spengeman can be seen HERE
✷ Pictures courtesy Rob Knott and John Tronolone can be seen HERE
